data.event: But Father Sebastien Rale (or Rasle), appointed missionary in 1694, was suspected of abetting the tribe's raids on English settlements.
British troops attacked the village in 1705 and again in 1722, but both times Father Rale escaped into the woods.

data.event: But on August 23, 1724, during Father Rale's War, soldiers attacked the village unexpectedly, killing 26 warriors and wounding 14, with 150 survivors fleeing to Canada.
Settled by English colonists about 1773, the land would be surveyed in 1791.
It was then officially incorporated on March 7, 1804, the town was named after United States president James Madison.
